Procedures
	Training
	Mechanical Integrity
	Management of Change
	Pre- Start Safety Review
	Compliance Audits
	Incident Investigation
	Employee Participation
	Hot Work Permit
	Contractors

Five-Year Accident History

For any accidental release meeting the five-year accident history reporting criteria of §68.42(a), the owner or operator shall submit as part of the RMP the information required by Section §68.42(b) on each accident covered by section §68.42(a).
The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

Lineage - Hilltop has had no releases in the last five years that meet the five-year accident history reporting criteria, therefore no data is required. 

Emergency Response Program

In addition, Lineage-Hilltop has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, to provide first aid and medical treatment, and to contact federal, state, and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia. The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, such as the local fire department or HAZMAT Team. 
Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:
	A Hazard Assessment, which was performed on March 8, 2024
	A Compliance audit, which was performed on April 11, 2022
	A 5-year Mechanical Integrity, which was performed on July 11, 2022.
	A Process Hazard Analysis, which was performed on August 23, 2021
Any outstanding recommendations from these studies and the target completion date or closure have been provided within each report.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source 

Lineage has a long-standing commitment to workers, public, and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  It is Lineage's policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  
The Program 3 at Lineage-Hilltop, is a facility-run program with continuous support from Lineage - Compliance Department that includes; Process Safety Management (PSM) Compliance and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Compliance.   

Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled

Lineage - Hilltop is located at 3040 Hilltop Road, in Moss Landing, California, which is approximately 3 miles south of the city of Watsonville. The area immediately surrounding the facility is agricultural. 
The regulated substance handled at the facility is anhydrous ammonia.  
The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.  All the ammonia inventory is used as refrigerant.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

As part of the implementation of the RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage-Hilltop, which also serve to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  The regulated substance is over 10,000 lbs. federal threshold for EPA RMP and OSHA PSM.   As a result, the anhydrous ammonia-covered process (ammonia refrigeration system) is subject to OSHA PSM and EPA Program 3.

Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:
	Process Safety Information
	Process Hazard Analysis
	Operating
